definition: loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)

sentences.english: But the parents of most young children can be confident that stealing is a pretty routine behavior.
sentences.chinese: 但家长们都要相信，小偷小摸真的是稀松平常。

sentences.english: in the inner city, a 50 percent dropout rate is not unusual.
sentences.chinese: 在这些城镇里面，50%的辍学率也是稀松平常的事。

sentences.english: Nothingis more familiar than the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么比时间流逝更稀松平常的了。

sentences.english: Do you think jet repos will become common?
sentences.chinese: 你认为回收飞机会变得稀松平常吗？

sentences.english: And, of course, its lavatories were unremarkable.
sentences.chinese: 当然，它的厕所也是稀松平常的。

sentences.english: Indeed, this advice has become a ubiquitous refrain.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这种建议已经变得稀松平常了。

sentences.english: It is common to eat bread or toast just dipped in olive oil.
sentences.chinese: 吃沾了橄榄油的面包和土司是稀松平常的事情。

sentences.english: Don't take such trivial matters to heart.
sentences.chinese: 别把这些稀松平常的事放在心里。

sentences.english: It was very usual to spend several days without food, " says Pablo, who was 18 at the time.
sentences.chinese: 一连几天不给食物稀松平常。
这是一段稀松平常的经历。

sentences.english: The loess of areola back is very loose, rain 1 points light rain and then will slip an ascent.
sentences.chinese: 小区后面的黄土非常稀松，下一点小雨就会滑坡。
